column2: in Section VII "The Heirs of Elendil"
column3: Christopher Tolkien explained that there were three manuscripts in the textual history of this section.  Manuscript A contained the information about the Southern Line of Gondor
column4: and from its condition it appeared to be the first stage of composition.  Manuscript B added the Northern Line
column5: and began as a fair copy of A for the Southern line but became heavily emended.  Manuscript B led to Manuscript C
column6: a fine copy (but with later emendations)
column7: which led to a final typescript D.  In the earlier Manuscripts A and B
column8: Anárions date of birth was  instead of . It was Isildur who was born in 3219 instead of 3209 and thus Anárion was the older of Elendils two sons.

column1: 2001-2007: The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game:
:Although Anárion does not appear in The Lord of the Rings (film series)
column2: Decipher produced a card for the character.
